WRITING.TEXT:
In Persia, revolts against Muslim rule did occur, they weren't able to avoid rebellion. For instance the revolt of Babak Khorramdin lasted for 20 years and saw the repeated defeats of Arab armies.
Also, the Sassanids did attempt a few concentrated efforts to reverse the territorial gains of the Muslims, but were defeated each time.

WRITING.TEXT: Yup, Carthage was established by the Phoenicians, specifically the city of Tyre. Though there were minor Phoenician settlements in Spain, they were greatly expanded after Carthage rose to prominence following the First Punic War
